title: Introduction of Lin Xiang Hong
text:
Hello! My name is Lin Xiang Hong, and I am currently a student at the Singapore Institute of Technology, pursuing a degree in Applied Artificial Intelligence.


I am dedicated to mastering the complexities of artificial intelligence to leverage its capabilities in solving real-world problems. My academic journey focuses on both the theoretical and practical aspects of AI, ensuring a robust and versatile understanding of this dynamic field.



When I am not engrossed in my studies, I enjoy cycling. Cycling not only keeps me physically fit but also provides a refreshing break from the mental demands of my studies, allowing me to return to my work with a clear and focused mind.



As I continue my academic career, I aim to develop innovative AI solutions that are both effective and ethical. I look forward to contributing to advancements in technology that can benefit society as a whole.
Thank you for taking the time to learn about me. I am excited about the opportunities and challenges that lie ahead in my field of study.

title: AI-Enhanced Cycling Route Planner
text:
This document serves as the introduction to the “AI-Enhanced Cycling Route Planner” project, spearheaded by Lin Xiang Hong, a student of Applied Artificial Intelligence at the Singapore Institute of Technology. The project aims to leverage advanced AI technologies to optimize cycling routes for safety and efficiency.




Enhance Cyclist Safety: Utilize AI to analyze traffic data and accident statistics to recommend the safest routes.
Improve Route Efficiency: Employ algorithms to optimize routes based on user preferences, such as shortest distance or scenic value.
User-Friendly Interface: Develop an intuitive application that allows cyclists to easily plan their routes.





Machine Learning: Use of predictive models to assess route safety and efficiency.
Data Analytics: Analysis of extensive datasets involving traffic patterns and historical accident data.
Mobile Application Development: Building a responsive and accessible app for both Android and iOS platforms.





Reduction in Cyclist Accidents: By providing safer routing options, we anticipate a decrease in the number of accidents involving cyclists.
Increased Cycling Popularity: With improved routing options, more individuals might be encouraged to cycle, promoting better health and reducing vehicle emissions.
Technological Advancement: Push the boundaries of applied AI in urban planning and personal transportation.




The “AI-Enhanced Cycling Route Planner” project combines cutting-edge AI technology with practical applications in urban mobility. By focusing on safety, efficiency, and user experience, this project aims to make cycling a more attractive option for commuters and enthusiasts alike.
Thank you for your interest in this project. For more information or to get involved, please contact Lin Xiang Hong at linxianghong@email.com.

title: Lin Xiang Hong’s Cycling Adventures
text:
I have a deep passion for cycling, which serves as the perfect escape from my rigorous studies in Applied Artificial Intelligence. Cycling not only keeps me physically active but also allows me to explore new places and enjoy a sense of freedom on the open road.


My bike of choice is the Specialized Tarmac Pro, equipped with a robust 35mm wide Wheel Angel wheelset. This setup is ideal for the long rides I often take to Malaysia, specifically to the picturesque regions of Kukup and Kulai. These destinations offer a mix of challenging routes and stunning scenery that make each trip worthwhile.

My Specialized Tarmac Pro 




Cycling has provided numerous benefits: enhanced physical fitness, mental clarity, and the joy of connecting with fellow cycling enthusiasts. It has become an integral part of my life where I find motivation and inspiration. Each ride is a new adventure, whether navigating the bustling roads or experiencing the quiet of rural landscapes.



I ride several times a week, with longer rides planned for weekends. This not only helps maintain my fitness but also prepares me for future cycling events. One of my short-term goals is to complete a century ride, a challenge I am eagerly preparing for.



Looking forward, I aim to integrate my knowledge of artificial intelligence with my passion for cycling to develop innovations that enhance safety and enjoyment for cyclists. By leveraging AI, I hope to create solutions that make cycling routes smarter and rides more enjoyable for the cycling community.
Thank you for reading about my cycling journey. I look forward to the many roads yet to be traveled and the stories yet to be told.
